intro: Lotononis plicata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Lotononis plicata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
